titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Lois M. Finney was a missionary at the American Mission in Egypt. She collected this material from the mission, though her term of service was later.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of mission meeting photos from the Zagazig School and the American Mission in Egypt. Group photographs include: staff of the American Mission in Cairo, 1910; 1951 annual Missionary Conference, New Wilmington, Pennsylvania; Zagazig class of 1931; 1900 Synod of the Nile; Missionary Association, 1897; Meeting of the Synod of the Nile, 1912; American Mission, 1885; Egyptian Pastors of Cairo and six missionaries, 1929; Synod of the Nile, 1900; wedding party of Mr. and Mrs. Robert W. Walker; and the last meeting of the Presbytery of Egypt, 1899. There are also shots of street scenes from Cairo, Luxor, and Mataria; photographic portraits and cartes de visites of missionaries and their families; as well as pictures of Theodore Roosevelt visiting the American College for Girls in Cairo. Additionally, there is a letter dated 1873 from the Board (possibly the Board of Foreign Missions) regarding the possible complicity of members of the Egyptian Mission in slavery.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Presbyterian Historical Society: Ralph C. McGill papers (accession 99 0920b) include photographs from American Mission in Egypt, 1904-1924.
